e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it emphasizes transparency and honesty in financial reporting, which is essential for building long-term trust with investors. Although some investors may initially misinterpret the change, the overall benefits of aligning with ethical practices and reducing potential legal risks outweigh the short-term adjustment challenges.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, honesty, and accuracy, ensuring that all financial information is presented fairly without biases or intentional misleading. It should also consider the needs of all stakeholders, including retail investors and regulators, while fostering trust and credibility. Additional context, such as industry standards and investor expectations, can also impact ethical judgment in financial reporting.
e6: Yes, I would want to understand how the management team plans to communicate the change to the investors effectively, ensuring that all stakeholders are informed and to mitigate any confusion. Additionally, I would ask about their strategy for monitoring investor reactions post-implementation and any measures they will take to support retail investors during the transition.
